Content:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> How can we get people to trade Verus on STEX and Crypto-Bridge more so that we get listed on CoinMarketCap.com ? Being visible on CMC would be great for marketing. Verus is now on two CMC exchanges, but we need some more trading volume on those before sending in a coin listing submission form to CMC, see this link for more info on CMC listing requirements:
https://coinmarketcap.com/methodology/#listings-criteria

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> @Crupti IMO, I think CMC has to come naturally, for Verus. Every project is different. And some value more aspects than others. 
I know that I personally, when I was very active with Verus, tried to make a case for directing more energy & effort to get listed on CMC. Because it is really the community standard, like BitcoinTalk is for announcing new or newer projects---CMC provides users w/historical price data, current price data, exchanges listings, token supply data, etc ..  It provides some degree of financial legitimiatcy, for new traders to look to, when researching a new project.. Most importantly, it would provide a new wave of community members.

Do you know the required volume & for what period of time? I've got a few things in mind.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Crupti> @10 (Not Giving away Eth) Only what the CMC "(3) Tips on getting your listing added" says: _"We evaluate many other factors besides the basic criteria when deciding to add a new listing. These factors include but are not limited to: ... -Trading Volume ‚Äì Trading volume and liquidity help with establishing a market price for users to acquire and sell cryptocurrencies..."_

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Oink> @Crupti @10 (Not Giving away Eth)  The option to move the exchange listing is worth considering. Keep in mind it is already prominent at the top of the ‚Äò**Get Verus**‚Äô Page for exactly that purpose, above the mining software and pools. It feels like a logical place to me. Would a different place on the website generate more trades on the exchanges, I wonder.
Links to VerusPay stores have come up before. I‚Äôm positive about it, haven‚Äôt given it much thought yet if, where and how to implement it on the website.

I feel we need build our media efforts towards the release of PBaaS by showing what we‚Äôre capable of at this moment. I‚Äôve had a lot of questions in DM the past couple of days about specifically merge mining and PBaaS and the general conclusion was that those persons had to get some VRSC, as investment or as start capital for a chain.
The fact that out Agama wallet was not vulnerable where the Komodo Agama wallet was and the effort of this community to release 0.5.7 and support the people using it as new replacement wallet, has earned us a lot of goodwill in the entire Komodo ecosystem and a lot of visibility as a result. How unfortunate the cause may be, it actually helps our visibility and a lot more people heard of us now.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <Godballz> This does seem to be a personal preference to some. @Oink brings up a good point in that we shouldn't lose focus. The only thing I have to say on verification of developers at this point in the project is similar to to what  @0x03. The constant work being pushed out regularly should be all the verification on the developers work ethics and the cooperation with other communities is a testament to their desire to make positive change to benefit us all. Mike has a long list of public contributions that are easily found. If anything, here, we should respect people's privacy.
I'm not saying this isn't valuable to some and maybe some may choose to add more info at some point, I'm only saying that a full scale merge mineable ecosystem is now coming to fruition and at this point it might be useful to stay focused on the things that are important to everyone.
